metadata.title: CVE-2023-39180 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found within the handling of SMB2_READ commands in the kernelksmbd module. The issue results from not releasing memory after itseffective lifetime. An attacker can leverage this to create adenial-of-service condition on affected installations of Linux.Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability, but onlysystems with ksmbd enabled are vulnerable.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
